text: Hey John, you mean like, you’d set a background image for a container, and if no background image exists, fall back to a specific color?

Here are scenarios where I use fallbacks:
1. If the image accidentally gets deleted, then usually a white bg shows. White text on white bg is not good.
2. The image takes a while to load and there is white text over it, then there will at least be a dark fallback background.
Ah, that makes total sense. Would you want that set at the template level? Or is that something you would want the marketer/content creator to be able to set?
The marketer. Currently when the content editor chooses the background type, the color option goes away. I propose it just stays visible when image or color is chosen as the bg type.
Perfect, that makes sense. I can definitely chat with the team more about this.

Hey folks, how are people feeling about building out drag and drop optimized templates? Would anyone here say they’d be ready to build out a site using drag and drop HubL?

We’ve been getting quite a bit of interest from customers to have their existing content updated to be optimized for drag and drop. I’m curious if anyone is setup yet to take on new customers who are looking for website rebuilds.
almost done with a dnd site
i subcontract to john so that means i am as ready as he is :wink:
Nice! That’s great to hear. I think there’s a _ton_ of opportunity out for anyone who’s able to rework existing content to be compatible with DnD, so that’s awesome!
